intro: Aplotaxis albescens, commonly known as the white kalahari bean, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Its seeds are enclosed in hairy, elongated pods and are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Aplotaxis albescens is adapted to arid environments and is often found in savannas and rocky areas.
